channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Remaining four ‘rebel’ Labour MPs have whip restored
item.description: Neil Duncan-Jordan, Chris Hinchliff, Brian Leishman and Rachael Maskell are last of series of penalised backbenchers to return to the party Four Labou...

item.title: James D Watson, co-discoverer of DNA’s twisted-ladder structure, dies aged 97
item.description: Nobel prize winner shaped medicine, crimefighting and genealogy but later years marred by racist remarks James D Watson, whose co-discovery of the twi...

item.title: Pentagon is shifting weapons purchases to ‘a wartime footing’, Hegseth announces - live
item.description: ‘The defense acquisitions system as you know it is dead,’ Hegesth says in a speech to industry leaders, military commanders and officials Andrew Roth ...

item.title: Washington National Opera may move out of Kennedy Center due to Trump ‘takeover’
item.description: Ticket sales at about 40% unsold compared with before president made himself chair of US performing arts center The Washington National Opera (WNO) is...

item.title: Students and faculty at over 100 US universities protest against Trump’s attacks
item.description: Student, national and local groups across US organized day of action to condemn Trump’s assault on academic freedom Students, faculty and staff at mor...

item.title: James Watson: Controversial discoverer of 'the secret of life'
item.description: James Watson, the godfather of DNA who discovered the "secrets of life" has died aged 97.

item.title: Israel receives coffin Hamas says contains body of Gaza hostage
item.description: If the body is identified as a hostage, five dead hostages will remain in Gaza and still need to be returned under a ceasefire deal.

item.title: DNA pioneer James Watson dies at 97
item.description: The Nobel Prize winner felt ostracised by the scientific community over his comments on race and intelligence.

item.title: Ex-footballer Joey Barton guilty over 'grossly offensive' X posts
item.description: The former footballer directed posts on X towards Jeremy Vine and pundits Lucy Ward and Eni Aluko.

item.title: Sabalenka beats Anisimova in 'incredible match' to reach Riyadh final
